findings.title: Token Manual Minting by Contract Owner
findings.description: The contract owner can arbitrarily mint tokens.

findings.title: Centralized Control of State Variable
findings.description: Controlling authorities can change critical state variables to gain additional profit.

findings.title: Improper Reward Update in Claim Functions
findings.description: User will lose reward that has not been updated when claiming $ETH before claiming the reward token.

findings.title: Transaction Ordering Dependence (Race Condition)
findings.description: Front-running attack can be performed resulting in a bad swapping rate and a lower bounty.

findings.title: Loop Over Unbounded Data Structure
findings.description: Gas consumption will increase as the size of tokenVaults increases.

findings.title: Insufficient Logging for Privileged Functions
findings.description: Privileged functionâ€™s executions cannot be monitored easily by users.

findings.title: Improper Function Visibility
findings.description: Public functions that are never called internally by the contract itself should have external visibility.
findings.location: Multiple contracts (GovLPVault, TokenVault, POWAA) and functions (initialize(), maxTotalSupply())

findings.title: Front-running attack due to zero amountOutMinimum parameter
findings.description: Front-running attack can be performed resulting in a bad swapping rate and a lower bounty.

findings.title: Improper Access Control
findings.description: Critical state variables can be updated at any time by the controlling authorities without notifying users.
findings.location: BaseTokenVault TokenVault GovLPVault (setRewardsDistribution(), notifyRewardAmount(), setMigrationOption(), migrate() functions)

findings.title: Business Logic Errors
findings.description: User will lose reward that has not been updated when claiming $ETH before claiming the reward token.
